results.title: The Secret life of twins. Part two
results.creator_credit: Judith Bunting, Learning Channel and BBC
results.brief_description: The 1960’s saw a proliferation in what we would now deem as a socially reprehensible, separating twins for the purposes of scientific research. What these studies do reveal however, are interesting questions about nature versus nurture - is everything pre ordained in our genes, or is parenting and the home environment responsible for who we become as adults? Program two looks at twins Jenny and Margaret who are reunited after 58 years, and the two Jims, brought up in two different countries, one raised as a Jew, the other a Nazi, for answers to the nature versus nurture question. Also tests the theory of twin telepathy. Presented by Robert Winston.

results.title: The Secret life of twins. Part three
results.creator_credit: BBC, Learning Channel and Liesel Evans
results.brief_description: The final episode in this series studies twins to look at issues such as the predisposition to phobias, mental illness, crime, and intelligence. Are these areas related to genetics or environment? Follows twin women in America who undergo plastic surgery so they can remain looking the same despite their different rates of aging, briefly looks at the most infamous of criminal twins, the Krays, and speaks to an incarcerated youth who says that his twin brother committed the crime. Presented by Robert Winston.

results.title: The Secret life of twins. Part one
results.brief_description: Twins are an endless source of fascination as well as a prolific avenue for scientific research - this three part series attempts to unravel why. Program one looks at the inherent physical dangers of sharing a womb and how the timing of the split alters the type of identical twin you are. It follows two pregnant mothers carrying twins, one of whom has a natural birth, the other a caesarean section. Includes an interview with famous twins photographer David Tepplicher and the amazing physical co-incidences he has come across in his work. We follow Siamese twins in America joined at the head who not only shared a womb, but also part of their brain, which raises interesting questions about personality. Presented by Robert Winston.

results.title: The Secret life of Sergei Eisenstien
results.creator_credit: Polivideo, Radio Televisione Svizzera Italiana (RTSI), SSR, BFI and Gian Carlo Bertelli
results.brief_description: This documentary on the great Russian film-maker Sergei Eisenstein, combines rare archival material with Eisenstein’s own candid memoirs written in the last years of his life. As well as a groundbreaking film director who developed a unique film language, Eisenstein was a prodigious theatre designer, teacher, theorist and draughtsman. Many of his satrical drawings are shown in this film. Also featured are interviews with his famous friends and colleagues, extracts from all of his films, including the very first, ‘Gulmov’s Diary’ and the only film record of Eisenstein speaking in English, in a wartime speech. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.

results.title: The Secret hunger
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and Gene Lawrence
results.brief_description: Illustrates the struggle of people against want and hunger as the pattern of life is traced from birth and childhood in Latin America, through marriage in Africa, adulthood in Asia and Indonesia. Problems impeding greater agricultural productivity are shown.

results.title: The Secret garden [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, American Zoetrope, Fred Fuchs, Fred Roos, Tom Luddy and Agnieszka Holland
results.brief_description: Frances Hodgson Burnett’s timeless tale “The Secret garden” has been stunningly recreated for the screen by the famed director of “Europa Europa”, Agnieszka Holland. Mary is a spoilt brat sent to England after her parents die in India. Her uncle’s house is forbidding and silent, and the housekeeper (Maggie Smith) is grim. Mary, unaccustomed to doing things for herself, is placed in the care of Martha the maid, who introduces Mary to her brother Dickon, a boy who can charm wild animals. Together, they discover a secret walled garden and a special friendship. The house also hides another secret and Mary discovers her crippled cousin Colin; an over-indulged, selfish child with an iron will equal her own. Mary, Dickon and Colin nurse not only the garden but the inmates of the house back to health. This film has excellent performances from the youthful cast of Kate Maberly, Heydon Prowse and Andrew Knott and is beautifully shot and costumed.

results.title: The Secret garden [Animated]
results.creator_credit: Greengrass Productions, Mike Young, Ellen Freyer and Dave Edwards
results.brief_description: Based on Frances Hodgson Burnett’s classic novel, this enchanting musical animated feature brings the story to life for yet another generation to cherish. Featuring radiant songs and a distinguished cast of voices, including Sir Derek Jacobi, Honor Blackman, Glynis Johns, Victor Spinetti and Frank Weller, this is quality entertainment for young viewers.

results.title: The Secret Files of J. Edgar Hoover
results.creator_credit: Joseph Honig, Western International Syndication and Jerry Kupcinet
results.brief_description: All personalities whose actions shaped 20th century America, and all unwitting stars in an infamous production are now revealed for the very first time in “The secret files of J. Edgar Hoover”. Power, fear, influence - serving under 8 presidents, he was accountable to none. Politicians came and went, but Hoover remained, a public servant who died a millionaire.
results.title_for_label: The Secret Files of J. Edgar Hoover
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Honig, Western International Syndication and Jerry Kupcinet

results.title: The Secret Discovery of Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This film reveals evidence which clearly shows that the Portuguese were on Australian soil long before either the Dutch or the English - in fact 250 years before Captain Cook. It is a story of spies and political espionage, resulting from the mantle of secrecy the Portuguese threw around their explorations and discoveries, and the efforts of their European counterparts to steal their maps.
